summary: trypsin inhibitors are divided into Kunitz type [11], Bowman-Birk type [12,13], and squash type [4] some of the proteins display a variety of biological activities, such as antifungal [9], immunomodulatory [5] and antitumor/antiproliferative [8,10] activities. y activity was located in fraction D2 when fraction D2 was subjected to affinity chromatography on Affi-gel blue gel. the activity was recovered in the larger unadsorbed fraction B1 (data not shown) Upon ion exchange chromatography on SP-sepharose, fraction B1 was resolved into a small unadsorbed fraction S1 and two large adsorbed fractions (S2 and S3) of approximately equal size. PSTI refers to the sequence of PSTI starting at amino acid residue #42 and ending at residue #81. Different letters indicate statistically-significant differences. assay of GBTI for inhibitory activity toward HIV–1 integrase. gold bean trypsin inhibitor (GBTI) is unadsorbed on Affi-gel blue gel, but adsorbed on DEAE-cellulose. this chromatographic behavior is distinctly different from that of other leguminous antifungal proteins which are unadsorbed on the ion exchanger. gold bean trypsin inhibitor is devoid of any inhibitory effect on HIV-1 integrase and SARS coronavirus proteinase. the absence of antifungal activity in gold bean trypsin inhibitor is also in agreement with the observation on some trypsin inhibitors. the supernatant was collected and loaded on a 5 20 cm column of deAE-cellulose (Sigma, St. Louis, MI, USA) in 10 mM Tris-HCl buffer (pH 7.4) after removal of unadsorbed proteins, the column was eluted sequentially with 0.2 M NaCl and 1 M NaCl. trypsin inhibitory activity was carried out by addition of test sample (20 L) to 160 L of a 1% casein solution in 0.1 M Tris-HCl buffer (pH 7.4) trypsin (20 L of a 0.5 mg/ml solution) was then added and the mixture was incubated at 37 °C for 15 min before 0.4 mL 5% trichloroacetic acid was added to terminate the reaction. purified trypsin inhibitor (2.5 M) was incubated in a water bath at different temperatures from 20 °C to 100 °C for 15 min, then immediately chilled on ice. reaction mixture was subjected to trypsin inhibitory activity. in a humidified atmosphere of 5% CO2 cells (1 104) were seeded into each well of a 96-well culture plate. radioactive precursor, 1 Ci ([3H-methyl]-thymidine, from GE Healthcare), was then added to each well and incubated for another 48 h. recombinant HIV-1 reverse transcriptase alyzes the cleavage of the substrate. a fixed amount (4–6 ng) of the protein was used. the inhibitory activity of the protein was calculated as percent inhibition compared to a control without the protein [15]. the pellet was homogenized in 50 mL buffer A (20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 2 M NaCl, 2 mM -mercaptoethanol) the suspension was rotated at 4 °C for 1 h, and cleared by centrifugation at 40,000 g for 20 min. the supernatant was loaded onto a 1-mL chelating Sepharose column. integrase reaction was performed in 20 mM HEPES (pH 7.5) containing 10 mM MnCl2, 30 mM NaCl, 10 mM dithiothreitol and 0.05% Nonidet-P40 (Sigma) the biotinylated DNA immobilized on the wells was detected by incubation with streptavidin-conjugated alkaline phosphatase. sterile blank paper disks were placed at a distance of 0.5 cm away from the rim of the mycelial colony. an aliquot (15 L) of the purified trypsin inhibitor was added to a disk. atant was collected and loaded on a 5 20 cm column of DEAE-cellulose. the column was eluted sequentially with 0.2 M NaCl and 1 M NaCl. the unadsorbed proteins (fraction B1) were dialyzed against 10 mM NH4Ac buffer (pH 5). purified trypsin inhibitor was incubated in a water bath at different temperatures from 20 °C to 100 °C for 15 min. after centrifugation, the absorbance of the supernatant, which reflects the amount of casein fragments, was measured at 280 nm. purified trypsin inhibitor (2.5 M) was incubated with dithiothreitol (DTT) at the final concentration of 2.5, 10 and 40 mM for 5, 20, and 80 min at 37 °C. the reaction was terminated by adding iodoacetamide at twice the amount of thiol functions at each DTT concentration. the remaining trypsin inhibitor activity was measured at pH 7.4. incorporated radioactivity was determined by liquid scintillation counting. assay takes advantage of the ability of reverse transcriptase to synthesize DNA. plasmid that expressed his-tagged wild-type HIV-1 integrase was grown at 37 °C until OD600 reached 0.7–0.8. cells were induced by addition of 0.8 mM IPTG (isopropyl-d-thiogalactopyranoside) the supernatant was loaded onto a 1-mL chelating Sepharose column. the column was washed with five column volumes of buffer A containing 50 mM imidazole. the in 20 mM Tris-HCl buffer (pH 8.0) containing 0.1 mM EDTA (Ethylenediamine Tetraacetic Acid), 2 mM -mercaptoethanol, 0.5 M NaCl and 5 mM imidazole. the pellet was homogenized in 50 mL buffer A (20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 2 M NaCl, HIV-1 integrase assay A non-radioactive ELISA-based assay was performed according to the DNA-coated plate method. 1 g of pBluescript SK was coated onto each well in the presence of 2 M NaCl as target DNA. the donor DNA was prepared by annealing VU5BR (5’-biotin-GTGTGGAAAATCTCTAGCAGT-3’) in 10 mM Tris-HC1, pH 8.0, the reaction was performed in a mixture containing 5 M SARS CoV protease, 5 M sample, 20 M substrate, and buffer for 40 min at 37 °C. after 40 min, the reaction was stopped by heating at 100 °C for 2 min. the reaction mixture was analysed by SDS-PAGE. kale antifungal peptide was purified from Phaseolus vulgaris cv. “gold bean”. it was dose-dependently inhibited trypsin with an IC50 value of 0.4 M.
